Role Overview
We are seeking experienced Chemistry professionals (PhD level) to contribute to the design, evaluation, and enhancement of AI systems replicating real-world chemistry workflows. You will apply deep subject expertise across organic, inorganic, physical, analytical, and biochemical domains to assess AI-generated scientific outputs and ensure academic rigor.

Key Responsibilities
- Create and review complex chemistry problems across multiple subfields.
- Evaluate AI-generated responses for accuracy, reasoning, and relevance.
- Provide detailed written feedback on mechanisms, problem sets, and chemical solutions.
- Collaborate asynchronously with AI researchers to refine and improve model performance.
- Maintain scientific precision and consistency in chemistry content used for AI training and evaluation.

Ideal Qualifications
- PhD in Chemistry or a closely related field.
- Undergraduate degree from the U.S., UK, Canada, or Europe (preferred).
- Deep knowledge across organic, inorganic, physical, analytical, and biochemical chemistry.
- Excellent written communication and analytical skills.
- Teaching, research, or publication experience is a strong plus.

Work Details
- Fully remote and asynchronous — flexible hours.
- Part-time (~20 hours/week), with potential to extend up to 40 hours/week.
- Independent contractor engagement.

Compensation: $65–$85/hour USD
